issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
On trunk (probably affects 4.0 too, but trunk is where i hit it):

ant test -Dtestcase=TestDocumentsWriterStallControl -Dtests.seed=9D5404FF4A909330

comments.body:

Seems like it might not be hung, but super-slow. most of the time i run this test it returns instantly.

on the other hand, about 25% of the time it takes minutes to complete!

yeah, thats the case with this seed:

BUILD SUCCESSFUL
Total time: 2 minutes 49 seconds
As a workaround for now, i set testAcquireReleaseRace to @Nightly until we can figure this out.
I reduced the # of checkpoints this test runs to keep that number low though.. can you check if that patch makes it faster for you? It never takes that long for me even in 1 k runs with random seeds

+1 to commit (and remove @nightly): with the patch this seed is 9 seconds. I also then ran the test w/o seed about 20 times and it never spun off for minutes.

It must be something about my # of cpus maybe? This reminds me of Uwe's 2-cpu problem with another test...
